SEARCH
Package boundary.ui

Class OfficerUI

java.lang.Object
boundary.ui.OfficerUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
CommonMenu, OfficerMenu
public class OfficerUI extends Object implements OfficerMenu
The OfficerUI class implements the OfficerMenu interface and handles the user interface for an officer. It provides the officer with various options such as registering a project, viewing available projects, checking registration status, and more.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    OfficerUI(Officer officer, Database db)
    Constructs a OfficerUI instance with the given officer and database.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    checkRegistrationStatus()
    Display the registration status of the officer.
    void
    displayMenu()
    Displays the menu options for the officer, allowing them to choose actions related to project registration, viewing projects, checking registration status, handling enquiries, and managing flat bookings.
    void
    handleFlatBook()
    Manages the flat booking process for the officer.
    void
    logout()
    Logs out the current officer, syncing any pending enquiries and displaying a logout message.
    void
    registerProjectAsOfficer()
    Registers the officer for a project.
    void
    viewAndReplyEnquiryList()
    Allows the officer to view and reply to project-related enquiries.
    void
    viewApplicationForms()
    Displays the application forms for the projects that the officer is handling.
    void
    viewHandledProject()
    Displays the details of the project that the officer is currently handling.
    void
    viewProjectsForApplyOfficer()
    Displays all available projects for the officer to apply to, based on visibility, open/close dates, and available officer slots.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
